attributes.description: Time limit to deploy oxygen masks upon cabin depressurization.
attributes.name: activationTime

attributes.description: Maximum storage duration for oxygen canisters.
attributes.name: storageLifetime

attributes.description: The range of cabin pressures in which the system can operate effectively.
attributes.name: operationalPressureRange

attributes.description: Number of redundant oxygen generation units.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Energy backup capability for uninterrupted operation when main power source fails.
attributes.name: powerBackup

designScenario.description: This design scenario for the Emergency Oxygen System outlines its role in providing breathable air to passengers and crew during a cabin depressurization event. Designed with robust fail-safe and real-time activation mechanisms, it integrates various components to manage oxygen storage, delivery, and monitoring, ensuring safety under emergency conditions.
designScenario.name: Emergency Oxygen System

details.description: Promptly deploy oxygen masks to all passengers and crew when triggered by cabin pressure thresholds.
Provide a continuous oxygen supply for a minimum of 15 minutes under full capacity.
Initiate within 3 seconds of activation signal.
Ensure no single point of failure compromises the systemâ€™s functionality.
Use non-combustible materials for oxygen storage and transfer.
Allow for routine maintenance accessibility and diagnostics without disrupting airplane operations.
Contain self-diagnostic routines ensuring availability within set response times.

relationships.description: The Control Unit oversees the activation of Distribution Modules based on inputs from Pressure Sensors.
The Oxygen Cylinder Module feeds oxygen to the Distribution Module during operations.
Redundant Pressure Sensors aggregate input data to the Control Unit for enhanced decision-making.

systemComponents.description: Monitors cabin pressure and activates the oxygen system at critical thresholds.
systemComponents.name: Pressure Sensor

systemComponents.description: Controls oxygen release and mask deployment based on sensor feedback.
systemComponents.name: Central Control Unit

subComponents.description: Processes Algorithm for critical oxygen release timing.
subComponents.name: Timing Processor

systemComponents.description: Stores medical-grade oxygen under high pressure for emergencies.
systemComponents.name: Oxygen Cylinder Module

systemComponents.description: Distributes oxygen to masks through valves.
systemComponents.name: Oxygen Distribution Module

subComponents.description: Controls oxygen flow to individual masks.
subComponents.name: Distribution Valve
